intro: Scorzonera prescottii, commonly known as the Prescott's scorzonera, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellowish-green flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces a tuberous root system, which is a distinguishing feature of the genus Scorzonera. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
